(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

nodes.body: Let me remove the "easy" tag: I don't think this is particularly hard, but it's not *totally* obvious either.
Filed #11951 for the ToAdditive changes.

:v: grunweg can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8592272995/job/23542062791)

bors d+
bors d+

This is a mis-match; shouldn't this attribute be renamed instead?
I don't see this attribute actually used in practice; according to comments, it seems unused. I'm fine reverting this, but wanted to call attention to this one.
It should be named however is needed to get the syntax for the attribute to be in snake case. Looking at the source for `register_label_attr`, it seems that `is_poly` is correct here.
I'm not sure if this is a correct change or not. Happy to revert.

It could go either way, since `infer_instance` is the tactic and `inferInstance` is the term.

It's probably better to avoid the question entirely and improve the docstring:
```suggestion
The tactic first checks to see that there is not already a `Nontrivial α` instance
before trying to synthesize one using other techniques.
```
I guess all the docs in this file ought to be updated; happy to split that into a separate PR.
@fpvandoorn

Thank you for the clarification.
```suggestion
/-- A stub attribute for `is_poly`. -/

Is this a desirable change? (I'm unsure.) If undesirable:
```suggestion
  `prod`, but this is applied to arguments, `α` and `β`.

I'm not sure if this change is desirable. If not, here's a revert:
```suggestion
  `prod`, but this is applied to arguments, `α` and `β`.
This one is good

`Bool.true` is exported to the root namespace, so `true` is the Lean 4 name for the value of `Bool`, so this is a bad fix (also elsewhere). `true`/`false` should only be capitalized if the type is meant.
Now this makes sense, thank you! I have hopefully fixed all instances.

```suggestion
local declarations in the same order (up to defeq, without setting mvars), and `false` otherwise.
```
